instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trolls or i am an idiot?
threads.message:
came with a blown DCIN fuse which is already a joke to see. Also short circuit on mains on the MagSafe board. After Fuse/Charging board replacement i got a fan spin and full choo-choo with a new battery.
On my bench. After full assembly, i put it on outcome desk and plugged in an original known-good Magsafe 60w charger which is perfectly compatible with 2012 mid 13' <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. No light, no charge, DCIN cycles on the charger (did not know board can do that, but okay though). Works with a 45w china crap-charger works with my bench cable which is probably also a crap cable.


SOLUTION:
thanks to 2informaticos: <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> reverse current protection circuit MosFeT: short-circuit between drain and gate. The original power brick is smart enough to cut down the power, bench PSU gives zero shits about reverse current.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trolls or i am an idiot?
threads.message: Get a KNOWN GOOD 85 watt magsafe for testing no need for any other wattage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trolls or i am an idiot?
threads.message:
It should start with 60W charger, original, or not.
Post values (ohm scale) for <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR>/86, measured onboard.
Usually bad <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trolls or i am an idiot?
threads.message:
jup, that was bad <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> semi-short between drain and gate. It was generally my laziness, i check gate-drain and call it OK. 
Thank you for the sollution!
